title.label: Great game, don’t play it on your phone

content.label:
This is the game I got Apple Arcade for, and it didn’t disappoint. It’s gorgeous and engrossing, and even though an initial play through only takes about an hour, there’s a lot of fun to be had in replaying levels over and over again to try for gold ranks. The soundtrack is a lot of fun, too! The gameplay itself is fairly simple but I don’t think that’s a bad thing.

I docked a star because the mechanics are just really clunky in the mobile version; the controls aren’t as responsive as I’d like them to be and some levels are almost impossible because of it. You can toggle sensitivity settings, which helps a little. I recently purchased the game on my Nintendo Switch, and I like the controls there much better. 

I think this game is a must-play, but if you can, play it on a console, or at least pair a controller to your phone.
Visually stunning
Love this game but it crashes on the Wild Hearts Never Die level for me. :-(
Bro this is by far worse game I ever even downloaded. Why is the story in the beginning has to be so long and I can’t skip it like I’m trying to play not go to bed. Worse game ever
This is the trippiest game i’ve ever played in the best way.
I can barely move the character even with high sensitivity

words can’t do this game justice. 

i deal with severe depression and i have for the last 3 years. i used to love art- drawing, filming, music, writing, and it stopped being fun to me. something about this game meant something, held something powerful, because after i played it, i sat down and i wrote. i wrote and i wrote and i wrote and i made more progress on my book than i have in years.

i cant thank you enough.

I don’t know who taped my childhood and adolescent dreams and made a game out of them, but I’d like my cut please. 

Although I’m kidding about “my cut”, I’m serious about the rest. It’s astounding to me. I used to put on headphones on a car ride and “run” through the trees, hills and cityscapes we drove through. I knew I was daydreaming but it felt real. Music was my escape, and those daydreams were inspired by my actual dreams. Flying, running and jumping great distances were ordinary pastimes. Leaving my body and floating up to the snow even though it was summer in reality was a touching experience, though I knew it was only a dream. The flying ship with the floating islands which were outlined as clouds... this brings it all back. Thank you for reminding me how free I used to feel!

I was brought to tears by level 3. This is, indeed, the work of Strong Creatives. Don’t lose that edge, guys! 

Also, my cat would like a sequel. He likes the bright lights. (What? Oh.) And the deer. 
🤍🦌

Sayonara
It’s an awesome game. Love the music and Queen Latifah narration!

This review is quite long 

     I like the idea of rhythm games but I’m not good at them. The same goes for sayonara wild hearts (SWH), that being said, WOW, amazing, brilliant, beautiful, stunning game. The story is original and not convoluted, nobody speaks but the narrator so far but the story is easy to parse. The levels are long enough to be satisfying but short enough to squeeze in on a short commute. The levels are very busy visually but it works so well because they are short. 

     I have adhd so it’s hard for me to focus on games for a while without getting bored, but SWH makes them so engaging and fun to look at that I can’t look away. The game has much replayability for two reasons in my opinion. One, the controls are challenging in a good way but eventually masterable. And two, they are so artistically good to look at. 

     This is the type of game where every frame is it’s own work of art. And the narrator!!! I’m not sure who she is but there is something about her voice that pulls at my heart. No matter how badly I did hearing the announcer proudly announce my rank make me feel awesome. If the smash announcer is ever changed I nominate whoever says your rank at the end of the levels. 

     My only gripe and one that is not worthy of taking the game down to 4 stars. Is that the controls are not as responsive as I would like. Sometimes I feel like the player character is not moving as much as they should with the distance I swipe on the screen and that I sometimes have to swipe two times all the way across the screen to get them to move a little bit. Again, this is not something that takes down my review to 4 stars. 

     If you’ve gotten this far... what are you doing?? Download this game!!
I’ve been playing games for 30 years, and this has blown my mind. Breathtaking, fun, exciting, relaxing, it is a visual marvel. Can’t wait to see more from this developer.
This is definitely the sickest games I have ever had on any of my iPhones ever!

I love the visuals of this game. It has a very unique stylistic look to it. Although, it says it’s a pop game, I just don’t hear any music. There’s nothing about it in the settings, there’s no way to toggle the music on and off. I’ve closed all the other apps in the background (one was GarageBand which I thought was the problem, no such luck) and it still doesn’t work. I assume the music goes along with the game and vice versa, but I can’t enjoy the full experience.
THIS IS SUCH A GOOD GAME IVE REDOWNLOADED IT 8 TIMES ALREADY

Sayonara Wild Hearts is a rhythm game. The graphics are super cool. The transitions are amazing. At first I’m riding a motor cycle then the game gives me laser cannons in the flashiest way possible. The hearts are place perfectly rewarding the player for going off the dev intended route. The music is super good. It really supports the theme and is so good it is actually better then normal music.
I just updated my iPad OS to the latest version and now the audio no longer works :(

I used to play some familiar games like this one, but this is the best one I had ever played.
For the difficulty, I think is hard or easy enough to me. After crash times I can pass it. But if you want to get a high rank that you need more practice. So the last one rewards I guess I can’t get it.
The  good points of the game is 1. Music 2. Fantastic views. 3. Interesting action.
I really like the music. I hope I can download them in the Apple Music. If you don’t mind, you can post some pictures in the game to show up the drawings.
Some insufficient places is the controller. I use my iPad to play the game. I can’t control the girl turn left or right easily. I have to swish it hardly or it just move little that the girl crashed.
I expect you guys would make a good new game.
Have to say, if you have epilepsy. Do not play this game. It’ll kill you!

content.label: I had to struggle getting all the zodiac riddle and some of them take a long time to complete!It take me some luck to solve some of them.

Whoa. I’ve never felt the need to review a game before, but this game really blew me away. Although the controls were a little hard to grasp at first, the really interesting gameplay made up for it. I really got hooked as I wanted to see how the gameplay would progress and change - and the graphics were a nice touch too. Well done!
The story interwoven with super cool visuals and pop music. This game is perfect in every way and made me feel multiple different emotions at the same time.

This is the best game I’ve ever played. It may look like a temple run-esc type of vibe, but it was WAY more than that. It may be a little short (my play time was about 1 hour and 17 minutes when I beat the game), but don’t let that decide if the game is worth your time or not. Trust me it is! I will play this game over and over again and you should too!

Despite how it appears, this isn't really a rhythm game. Outside of a few instances of rhythmic timing, I would say it more closely resembles an old-school on-rails "shooter". Still, it's amazing how much gameplay variety the developer ekes out of this basic setup.

An abstract story of heartbreak sets you on a journey through the protagonist's metaphorical landscape of grief, where you'll try to collect as many hearts as possible, all while avoiding any obstacles and battling with the adversaries therein. In terms of the moment-to-moment gameplay, it's a simple offering, but the style--goddamn, the style! Sayonara Wild Hearts is one of the most stunning examples of visual design I've ever seen. The aesthetic here is instantly appealing, and every inch of the screen glows with stark, vibrant geometry.

Complementing these visual delights is a fantastic soundtrack that melds EDM, airy pop ballads, and pretty out-there arrangements of Debussy piano classics--some of my personal favorites!

There are a couple of flaws. The controls feel unresponsive and floaty, and sometimes the presentation makes the game harder than it needs to be, with flashy lights and stage animations confusing the eye. These are trivial issues, though.

At just over and hour, give or take, I wholeheartedly recommend Sayonara Wild Hearts to just about anyone. So steel your heart, strap on your motorcycle helmet, and get into the groove.

P. S. If the narrator/announcer's voice sounds familiar, there's a reason. Watch until the end of the credits!

This game is the bomb. It’s concept is what makes the game fresh and surprising. The Matrix meets, Hidden Dragon, meets Tron with a super hero in the making kind of feel. Almost like you are in a dream or the best part of a movie. Nice to see this kind of creativity. Hoping to see more like this. Thank you!

I honestly think this is the best and all time favorite game I have ever played on my phone. The music is lovely, Queen Latifah’s voice narrating is pretty cool and oddly soothing, and the graphics and visuals are fantastic, they remind me of sailor moon in the best way possible, just with an added tarot card aspect that’s really wonderful. All around just rad and undeniably awesome game. Give it a shot, the message at the end after beating all the levels is one hell of a shout out to girl power!
